intro: Polygonum australe, commonly known as the Australian knotweed, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant features upright, branched stems that are often covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a prominent midrib and are usually arranged alternately along the stem. Small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
